metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32556 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that the get_modified_conffiles() function in backends/packaging-apt-dpkg.py allowed injecting modified package names in a manner that would confuse the dpkg(1) call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18').
